description: From Medieval Latin exhumō, from Latin ex- + humō (“to bury”).

verbs.description: exhume (third-person singular simple present exhumes, present participle exhuming, simple past and past participle exhumed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dig out of the ground; to take out of a place of burial; to disinter.
examples: The archeologist exhumed artifacts from the ground with a shovel.

entries.meaning: (transitive, figurative) To uncover; to bring to light.
examples: Memorial was permeated by a sense of mission, a moral imperative to exhume the truth and display it to the eyes of its compatriots, whatever feelings of shame, outrage, denial, or shock might ensue.
